en.p6.1: Solar, Wind, Hydroelectric, and Geothermal Energy
en.p6.4: Solar energy comes from the Sun. It is an inexhaustible and clean source that can be used to produce electricity or heat.
en.p6.6: 1. Photovoltaic solar energy: Uses solar panels that convert sunlight directly into electricity. Each panel contains photovoltaic cells made of silicon.
en.p6.7: 2. Solar thermal energy: Uses solar collectors that absorb the sun‚Äôs heat to warm water or air, mainly in homes or industries.

en.p6.19: Wind energy is obtained from the wind, that is, from the movement of air.
en.p6.21: Wind turbines (modern windmills) have large blades that turn with the wind. This movement drives a generator that converts mechanical energy into electricity.
